i.b: 70 Union Hill Rd., Madison, NJ. 07940● Mobile

page.text: 2005-Present
Cornell University, Ithaca, New York
Policy Analysis and Management Major
Bachelor’s Degree May ‘09
This major includes a heavy focus on economic theory and the application of statistics.
Morristown-Beard School, Morristown, NJ
Academic and effort honor rolls every semester.
AP courses include: US History, European History, Statistics, English Literature, Biology.
Honors courses include: English, science, math, history, French.
Club president: Model UN, AFS.
Cum Laude Society (academic honor society)
History Department Prize, President’s Award for Academic Excellence and William C. Mules
Prize for “love of learning”.
College Board AP “Scholar With Distinction” for advanced placement achievements.
Deans List at Drew University.
Legislative District of New Jersey, Summit, NJ.
Intern
Assist with constituent relations, including general office duties, such as updating databases,
filing, correspondence and answering phones. Research and special projects, as requested.
Successfully completed two full-time weeks in this office for senior project in May, 2005.
Kean Campaign for US Senate, Mountainside NJ.
Intern
Cold calling constituents for both fundraising and polling as well as some basic projects
and data entry.
Blockbuster, Madison, NJ.
CSR (Customer service representative)
Checking movies into and out of the store, stocking films and foods, assisting customers
with queries and cashiering.
Corporation for Supportive Housing (CSH), Trenton, NJ.
Intern
Assisted with calculation of numbers and writing of reports as well as developing housing
development plans for counties seeking to eliminate homelessness.

text.b: SUMMER LANGUAGE, CULTURAL STUDY, AND OTHER INTERESTS

page.text: Extensive intercultural experience. Lived with a French-Vietnamese family and an
Algerian-French family while studying in France during the summers of 2002 and 2003.
Program sponsors were AFS and Rassias
Student Exchanges. Lived with students from Belgium, Thailand, Hungary, Chile and
Germany through a student exchange program for a total of nearly 6 years.
Interests. Reading historical, political and economic literature
Clubs, Phi Sigma Pi (co-ed national honors fraternity), Table Tennis.

Academic and effort honor rolls every semester.
AP courses include: US History, European History, Statistics, English Literature, Biology.
Honors courses include: English, science, math, history, French.

Intern
Assist with constituent relations, including general office duties, such as updating databases,
filing, correspondence and answering phones. Research and special projects, as requested.
Successfully completed two full-time weeks in this office for senior project in May, 2005.
Intern
SUMMER LANGUAGE, CULTURAL STUDY, AND OTHER INTERESTS
Extensive intercultural experience. Lived with a French-Vietnamese family and an
Algerian-French family while studying in France during the summers of 2002 and 2003.
Program sponsors were AFS and Rassias
Student Exchanges. Lived with students from Belgium, Thailand, Hungary, Chile and
Germany through a student exchange program for a total of nearly 6 years.
Interests. Reading historical, political and economic literature
